problem_text:
The prime graph of a finite group G is the graph with vertex set π(G) and an edge joining p and q if and only if G has an element of order pq. Describe all finite Chevalley groups over a field of characteristic 2 whose prime graph is not connected and describe the connected components.
A. S. Kondratiev
answer: This was done in (A. S. Kondratiev, Math. USSR–Sb., 67 (1990), 235–247).
